title: Day 3 – Hybrid Machine Learning + Geostatistics
text:
Today’s Goal
Integrate:

Machine learning

Spatial geostatistics

Hybrid prediction modelling

title: Day 3 – Hybrid Machine Learning + Geostatistics
text:

library(readr)
hybrid_ml_geo <- read_csv("../data/hybrid_ml_geostatistical_data.csv")
head(hybrid_ml_geo)

title: Day 1 – Spatial & Spatio-temporal Modelling
text:
Welcome to Day 1

Spatial geostatistical modelling

Spatio-temporal extensions

Malaria data simulated for Nigeria

All modelling uses UTM coordinates

title: Day 1 – Spatial & Spatio-temporal Modelling
text:
Load the Data

library(readr) 
spatial_binom <- read_csv("../data/spatial_binomial_data.csv")
head(spatial_binom)

# A tibble: 6 × 10
     id   utm_x    utm_y n_tested n_pos prevalence_true       S elevation  ndvi
  <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>

2     2  58859. 1077815.       64    30           0.632  0.680     165.   0.827
3     3 437997.  476112.       67    17           0.287  0.489     359.   0.158
4     4 380293. 1341662.      188    77           0.419 -0.101       8.90 0.981

title: Day 1 – Spatial & Spatio-temporal Modelling
text:
Overview
On Day 1 we will:

Load the spatial malaria datasets
Work with UTM coordinates
Build SPDE meshes
Fit spatial and spatio-temporal models with inlabru

title: Day 1 – Spatial & Spatio-temporal Modelling
section: Load data (once CSVs are in data/)
text:
Load data (once CSVs are in data/)


Code
library(tidyverse)

spatial_binom <- read_csv("data/spatial_binomial_data.csv")
head(spatial_binom)


# A tibble: 6 × 10
     id   utm_x    utm_y n_tested n_pos prevalence_true       S elevation  ndvi

title: Day 1 – Spatial & Spatio-temporal Modelling
text:
Quick plot of locations (UTM)


Code
ggplot(spatial_binom, aes(utm_x, utm_y, colour = n_pos / n_tested)) +
geom_point() +
coord_equal() +
scale_colour_viridis_c(name = "Prevalence") +
theme_minimal()

title: Geostatistical Modelling with inlabru
text:
This workshop is funded by the London Mathematical Society (LMS) Scheme 5.

Welcome to the Geostatistical Modelling with inlabru workshop.
This 3-day workshop covers:

Spatial and spatio-temporal analysis (different likelihoods)
Joint modelling of multiple malaria processes
Non-stationary spatial processes
Hybrid machine learning + geostatistical models

title: Day 2 – Joint modelling and Non-stationary processes
text:
Today we will cover two key advanced topics in spatial modelling:

Joint modelling of multiple malaria processes

Shared spatial fields

Process-specific fields

Multiple outcomes (e.g., children vs pregnant women)

Non-stationary spatial processes

Region-varying smoothness

Covariate-driven nonstationarity

Combining multiple spatial SPDEs

title: Day 2 – Joint modelling and Non-stationary processes
text:
Today we will cover two key advanced topics in spatial modelling:

Joint modelling of multiple malaria processes

Shared spatial fields

Process-specific fields

Multiple outcomes (e.g., children vs pregnant women)

Non-stationary spatial processes

Region-varying smoothness

Covariate-driven nonstationarity

Combining multiple spatial SPDEs

title: Day 2 – Joint modelling and Non-stationary processes
text:
Load Day 2 datasets


Code
library(tidyverse)

joint_malaria <- read_csv("data/joint_malaria_processes.csv")
nonstat_malaria <- read_csv("data/nonstationary_malaria_data.csv")

head(joint_malaria)


# A tibble: 6 × 12
     id group    utm_x  utm_y n_tested n_pos prevalence_true S_shared S_specific
  <dbl> <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>    <dbl>      <dbl>
1     1 childr… 2.71e5 6.47e5      156    68           0.470   0.680     -0.0220
2     2 childr… 1.03e6 1.07e6      199    57           0.253  -0.0229    -0.324 
3     3 childr… 1.03e6 1.23e6       83    18           0.216  -0.600     -0.428 
4     4 childr… 8.62e5 1.11e6      193   137           0.712   0.976     -0.236 
5     5 childr… 8.08e4 8.40e5       76    45           0.491   0.656     -0.286 
6     6 childr… 5.42e5 9.87e5      117    61           0.552   1.42      -0.266 
# ℹ 3 more variables: elevation <dbl>, ndvi <dbl>, urban <dbl>


Quick visualisation


Code
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(joint_malaria, aes(utm_x, utm_y, colour = group)) +
geom_point() +
coord_equal() +
theme_minimal()









Quick visualisation (non-stationary dataset)


Code
ggplot(nonstat_malaria, aes(utm_x, utm_y, colour = prevalence_true)) +
geom_point() +
coord_equal() +
scale_colour_viridis_c() +
theme_minimal()

title: Day 3 – Hybrid Machine Learning + Geostatistics
text:
Today we combine:

Machine learning models (e.g., Random Forest, XGBoost)
Spatial residual modelling via SPDE + inlabru
Hybrid prediction pipelines for malaria prevalence

The goal:
Use ML to model complex covariate effects, and INLA/SPDE to model spatial dependence in the residuals.

title: Day 3 – Hybrid Machine Learning + Geostatistics
text:
Today we combine:

Machine learning models (e.g., Random Forest, XGBoost)
Spatial residual modelling via SPDE + inlabru
Hybrid prediction pipelines for malaria prevalence

The goal:
Use ML to model complex covariate effects, and INLA/SPDE to model spatial dependence in the residuals.

title: Day 3 – Hybrid Machine Learning + Geostatistics
text:
Load Day 3 dataset


Code
library(tidyverse)

hybrid_ml_geo <- read_csv("data/hybrid_ml_geostatistical_data.csv")

head(hybrid_ml_geo)


# A tibble: 6 × 11
     id    utm_x    utm_y n_tested n_pos prevalence_true ml_signal_true
  <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>          <dbl>
1     1  387215. 1485399.       59     0     0.000334            -7.06 
2     2 1046370.  758144.      180     8     0.0496              -1.66 
3     3  681525. 1102741.      164    22     0.167               -0.980
4     4  713355. 1127489.       62     0     0.00476             -4.17 
5     5  276748. 1384709.       84     0     0.00000423         -11.6  
6     6 -112576. 1315376.       60     0     0.000000669        -12.5  
# ℹ 4 more variables: S_residual_true <dbl>, elevation <dbl>, ndvi <dbl>,
#   urban <dbl>


Visualise ML signal + spatial residuals


Code
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(hybrid_ml_geo, aes(utm_x, utm_y, colour = ml_signal_true)) +
geom_point() +
coord_equal() +
theme_minimal()

title: Day 2 – Joint Modelling + Non-stationarity
text:
Today’s Focus

Joint models
Shared vs group-specific fields
Non-stationary spatial processes
